citations.narrative:
On 9/21/23 a non-human primate (NHP) was sedated by a research technician for an approved study activity. When the
research technician opened the door to the top enclosure of the quad unit to retrieve the sedated NHP, the animal fell
from the enclosure onto the floor. The research technician then grasped the tail to secure the animal. The animal was
assessed and treated for minor injuries by veterinary staff after animal husbandry staff members present in the room
reported the incident.
Research staff failed to carefully handle this animal while sedated when it was allowed to fall from the enclosure and
when they held the tail to secure the animal. Per this Section, the handling of animals by all personnel, including
laboratory research staff, should be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause physical harm,
behavioral stress, or unnecessary discomfort.
This incident was identified by the facility and corrective measures were implemented prior to inspection, which included
the retraining of staff on animal handling practices. To remain corrected from this day 3/14/24 forward.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
*END OF REPORT*
Additional Inspectors:
EILIS KARR, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.38(f) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
On 9/21/23 a non-human primate (NHP) was sedated by a research technician for an approved study activity. When the 
research technician opened the door to the top enclosure of the quad unit to retrieve the sedated NHP, the animal fell 
from the enclosure onto the floor. The research technician then grasped the tail to secure the animal. The animal was 
assessed and treated for minor injuries by veterinary staff after animal husbandry staff members present in the room 
reported the incident. 
 
Research staff failed to carefully handle this animal while sedated when it was allowed to fall from the enclosure and 
when they held the tail to secure the animal. Per this Section, the handling of animals by all personnel, including 
laboratory research staff, should be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause physical harm, 
behavioral stress, or unnecessary discomfort.  
 
This incident was identified by the facility and corrective measures were implemented prior to inspection, which included 
the retraining of staff on animal handling practices. To remain corrected from this day 3/14/24 forward. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.  
 
*END OF REPORT* 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
EILIS KARR, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
